p: In case 1 (see main manuscript and Fig. 2c), atmospheric model surface heat flux biases drive local SST biases through balancing surface heat flux response, i.e. small ∆ C O and ∆ C R so ∆ F R ≈ λ F∆ T ≈ −∆ F A. The atmospheric model provides surplus heat into the surface which causes the local SST to warm resulting in a compensating positive surface heat loss response (or vice-versa). We expect for R1 a strong negative correlation of ∆ F R on SST biases; for R2 an approximately compensating strong positive correlation of SST biases on ∆ F A; for R3 a strong negative correlation of ∆ F R on ∆ F A; and for R4 no correlation of SST biases on coupled net flux difference (∆ F), since ∆ F = ∆ F R + ∆ F A ≈ 0. Our results are broadly consistent with all of these expectations.
